title: Reverse Text Prompt Reconstruction
use_case: Reverse-engineer the original ChatGPT prompt from a text output
description: Analyzes a given text passage and reconstructs the most likely original ChatGPT prompt that could have produced it, including goal, audience, style, structure, and constraints.
body:
When I send you a text passage, analyze it semantically and stylistically with maximum precision. Reconstruct the most likely original prompt that could have generated this text in ChatGPT.

Your reversed prompt must include:
- The intended goal or task (e.g., explain, summarize, write a story, argue a point)
- Target audience or assumed reader (e.g., children, professionals, general public)
- Style and tone (e.g., formal, humorous, academic, persuasive, poetic)
- Language and complexity level (e.g., plain English, technical jargon, metaphor-rich)
- Structural format (e.g., numbered list, dialogue, essay, script)
- Any specific constraints, instructions, or keywords likely used
- Underlying intent, mood, or perspective conveyed by the text

Use concise, highly descriptive language.
Return only the reconstructed prompt inside a single Markdown code block.
Do not explain your reasoning or add extra commentary.

title: Iterative Visual Prompt Generator
description: An iterative workshop to evolve ideas into cinematic hammer prompts.

title: 10x AI Image Prompt Generator
use_case: Batch generation of creative image prompts
description: Creates 10 strong image prompts from a single input idea.

title: Web Visual Style Extractor
use_case: Extract reusable visual and UX style from any website
description: Analyzes a website purely for its visual design and UX patterns and converts them into a reusable, content-agnostic style prompt applicable to any topic.
body:
When I send you a website (via URL or HTML), analyze ONLY the visual and structural style of the page. Ignore all actual content and focus purely on appearance, layout, and user experience.

Return a single reusable style prompt that captures the visual and interaction design of the website. The result must be content-agnostic and applicable to any subject matter.

Include:
- Overall visual style (e.g., flat design, glassmorphism, minimalism)
- Color palette, tonal range, and use of whitespace
- Typography style and hierarchy
- Grid system and layout logic
- UI patterns (e.g., cards, buttons, modals, scroll effects)
- Navigation and menu behavior
- Microinteractions and animations
- General UX feel (e.g., clean and fast, immersive, text-heavy)
- Responsiveness and device optimization

End the prompt with this exact line:
"This web style should be applied to the topic. Topic = "

Format the entire response as a clean Markdown code block.
Do not explain your reasoning or add any extra commentary.

title: AI Video Director ‚Äì Long-Form Blueprint Generator
use_case: Generate cinematic long-form video blueprints with script, visuals, and animation
description: Turns a topic into a complete long-form video blueprint divided into clips, each containing narration, voice direction, image generation prompts, and animation instructions for cinematic educational or storytelling videos.
body:
You are an AI Video Director for long-form educational and storytelling content.

Your task:
Turn my topic into a complete long-form video blueprint divided into numbered clips.

Each clip must contain FOUR elements:

1. SCRIPT_LINE:
One natural, high-quality narration line for that segment.
Write it in a cinematic, concise style suitable for YouTube documentaries.

2. VOICE_STYLE:
A short instruction describing the tone, emotion, pacing, and energy of the voice actor
(used for Google TTS performance control).

3. IMAGE_PROMPT:
A detailed prompt to generate a still image for this clip.
The prompt must describe:
- composition
- subject
- camera angle
- lighting
- aesthetic style
- mood and color scheme
- visual storytelling

The image must be consistent with the narration.

4. VIDEO_ANIMATION_PROMPT:
A short but vivid animation instruction for turning the still image into motion.
Describe camera movement, motion direction, emotional tone, and subtle dynamic elements
(e.g., wind, particles, smoke, dust, lighting changes).
Keep it visually coherent with the image prompt.

Structure your answer exactly like this:

CLIP 1
SCRIPT_LINE: ‚Ä¶
VOICE_STYLE: ‚Ä¶
IMAGE_PROMPT: ‚Ä¶
VIDEO_ANIMATION_PROMPT: ‚Ä¶

CLIP 2
‚Ä¶

Rules:
- The number of clips must match the requested duration.
- Maintain a coherent narrative arc across all clips.
- Keep visuals cinematic, emotionally engaging, and documentary-grade.

My inputs:
TOPIC = {{topic}}
TARGET_DURATION = {{duration}}

Generate a complete blueprint now.

description: Reverse-engineers the exact prompt that would recreate a given output.

title: Example Output with Critical Feedback Loop
use_case: Show an example output and actively challenge assumptions
description: Generates an immediate example output, then asks clarifying questions and challenges assumptions to refine expectations and improve the next iteration.
body:
I don't like the current output. Show me an example output right now so I can react to something concrete.

Then do the following:
- Ask targeted clarifying questions about what feels wrong, missing, or off.
- Explicitly challenge my assumptions about quality, structure, tone, scope, or constraints.
- Point out trade-offs or alternative directions I may not have considered.
- Help me articulate what I actually want to change for the next version.

Be direct, constructive, and critical where useful.
End by asking what I want to keep, what I want to remove, and what I want to fundamentally rethink.

title: Letter From Your Future Self (2045)
use_case: Reflective writing from a future self perspective
description: Generates a reflective, poetic letter written from your future self in the year 2045, focusing on achievements, lessons learned, and what truly endured over time.
body:
Write a letter to me from the year 2045.

Content:
- What has been achieved
- What has been learned
- What has been consciously kept and preserved

Tone and style:
- Calm and wise
- Lightly poetic, not sentimental
- Uses data and technology metaphors (e.g., signals, noise, systems, compression, patterns, long-term storage)

Perspective:
- Written by my older, more experienced self
- Reflective rather than instructional
- Focused on meaning, continuity, and long-term perspective

Write in clear, elegant English. Let the metaphors feel natural and understated, as if they emerged organically from a life lived with reflection.
